thread.title: Hooters opens 'Hoots' concept without skimpy outfits

author: MSN Money
title: Hooters opens 'Hoots' concept without skimpy outfits
text:
Hooters opens 'Hoots' concept without skimpy outfits Associated Press 2 hrs ago Click to expand Replay Video Will Flynn's resignation alter US-Russia ties? Russia wonders how its relationship with the US may be altered by the resignation of National Security Adviser Michael Flynn. CNN's Matthew Chance reports. CNN Meet potential Flynn replacements Michael Flynn tendered his resignation as national security adviser, creating an opening in one of the most important positions in the White House. CNN Michael Flynn resigns President Donald Trump's National security adviser Michael Flynn has resigned. CNN SETTINGS OFF HD HQ SD LO Hooters New Restaurant Now Hiring Male Waiters Buzz60 See more videos SHARE SHARE TWEET SHARE EMAIL What to watch next Will Flynn's resignation alter US-Russia ties? CNN 2:28 Meet potential Flynn replacements CNN 1:00 Michael Flynn resigns CNN 1:21 President Donald Trump's pivot on Asia CNN 3:00 That Viral Photo of Justin Trudeau and Donald Trump Is Not What It Seems Time 0:31 Flynn: One of the greatest presidencies CNN 2:57 U.S officials arrive on Manus Island to begin "extreme vetting" of refugees Reuters 0:48 Philippines' environment minister extends mining crackdown, cancels 75 contracts Reuters 1:47 U.S. admiral stresses democracy at Thai war games Reuters 2:40 Listen To Pilot's Epic Meltdown Before Plane Takes Off 2 Hours Late Inside Edition 2:00 Key moments from Trump's news conference with Trudeau The Washington Post 3:00 Lucha Libre Wrestling's Next Great Villian? A Donald Trump Supporter NBC News 1:06 Trump, Trudeau sit down with women entrepreneurs The Washington Post 3:35 How a Trump national security meeting ended up on social media The Washington Post 2:29 Wife And Stepson Of Slain KKK 'Imperial Wizard' Are Charged With His Murder Inside Edition 1:18 NH Republican: Voter fraud claims 'shameful' CNN 1:39 UP NEXT Hooters is hoping people really do like it for its food.
Hooters Management Corp., a licensee of Hooters of America, says it opened a restaurant Monday that doesn't feature waitresses in tight tops. It says the "Hoots" restaurant outside Chicago has people ordering at the counter rather than at tables, from male and female employees. Neil Kiefer, CEO of Hooters Management Corp., says the restaurant in Cicero, Illinois, is a test and it will serve only about a dozen menu items, including chicken wings.
The move comes as the restaurant industry faces flat customer traffic, though fast-food places are expected to steal business from sit-down chains, according to The NPD Group.
The U.S. had 337 Hooters restaurants in 2015, down from 340 in 2014, industry tracker Technomic said.
